intro: Nephrodium fuscipes, commonly known as the dark-stemmed nephroid, is a rare and specialized fern species found in specific tropical regions. It belongs to the family Nephridiaceae and is characterized by its unique, intricately divided fronds that resemble the shape of a kidney. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often in forest undergrowth where it can receive indirect light. Its reproductive structures, including sporangia, are typically located on the underside of its leaves, a common feature among ferns. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Nephrodium fuscipes is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
